info.title: 1WorldSync Content1 API
info.description:
1WorldSync Content1 API

Content1 will provide access to accurate, trusted product data sourced directly from the Brand Owners through 1WorldSyncâ€™s APIs. This full set of product information is readily available to you through a set of web services, allowing you to get up-to-date, complete product information.

The following APIs are available
  • Product Count API - Performs a search against the product data published in ContentNOW to find product count that meet the supplied criteria. You can user only four fields i.e. GLN, GTIN, Target Market and Last Modified Date to search data.
  • Product Fetch API - Once a Product Search has been performed (and you have received a count), the full set of atrribute information on a given product can be retrieved using the Product Fetch API. This is a paginated API which means you need to mention the offset count and the page size. It is preferred that you make sequential calls.

This tool features a fully functional form which will call the Content1 API in real time. To unlock the API call, you must have your client secret key provided through developer.1worldsync.com. Enter that key in the top right of this page to unlock the API calls used below.

post.summary: This method will return product count for a given search criteria.
post.description: This method will return product count for a given search criteria.

parameters.name: hashcode
parameters.description: Hash of secret key, URL and timestamp

parameters.name: gln
parameters.description: Data requested for the GLNs (comma separated for multiple, no space required or Click the "Add Item" button)

200.description: will return count of products on a given criteria

401.description: For any Authorization, Authentication and validation error

post.summary: This method will return list of products for a given search criteria.
post.description: This method will search for products on a given search criteria and will return data in paged way. Page size can be mentioned in the request parameter. Using of "searchAfter" in request body will give you next page data.

parameters.name: hashcode
parameters.description: Hash of secret key, URL and timestamp

parameters.name: gln
parameters.description: Data requested for the GLNs (comma separated for multiple, no space required or Click the "Add Item" button)

500.description:
• when page size is more then 1000
  • when error occurred in processing

401.description: For any Authorization, Authentication and validation error

post.description: This method will return item hierarchy details based on a given search criteria and will return data with pagination. Page size can be mentioned in the "size" parameter. Using of "searchAfter" in request body loads next page.

parameters.name: hashcode
parameters.description: Hash of secret key, URL and timestamp

parameters.name: gln
parameters.description: Data requested for the GLNs (comma separated for multiple, no space required or Click the "Add Item" button)

500.description:
• Requested page size is grater than 1000
  • Internal error occured

401.description: For any Authorization, Authentication and validation error

requestId.description: An unique id generated at server end to track processing of this request

reason.description: Error reason in human readable form

ItemFetchError.description: Error response object. you will receive this object when there is an error in server side in processing

sortFields.description: Fields that will be sorted upon

searchAfter.description: This field is used to fetch item in batch. To retrieve the next page of the items. You need to set searchAfter in search criteria from previous result.

items.description: This field is used to fetch item in batch. To retrieve the next page of the items. You need to set searchAfter in search criteria from previous result.

field.description: Fields that will be sorted upon. Ex: gtin, informationProviderGLN and targetMarket etc.

SortField.description: Fields that will be sorted upon

message.example: To retrieve the next page of products, pick what you have received in searchAfter and set it in next request.

searchAfter.description: This value is used to fetch next page of hierarchies.

items.description: This value is used to fetch next page of hierarchies.

include.description: To retrieve subset of attributes from item. Ex: ["gtin","informationProviderGLN","targetMarket","lastModifiedDate","brandName","gpcCategory","externalFileLink"]

items.description: To retrieve subset of attributes from item. Ex: ["gtin","informationProviderGLN","targetMarket","lastModifiedDate","brandName","gpcCategory","externalFileLink"]

exclude.description: To abandon some of attributes from item. Ex: ["*.gln","externalFileLink.sharedWith"]

items.description: To abandon some of attributes from item. Ex: ["*.gln","externalFileLink.sharedWith"]

FetchFields.description: Fields to be include or exclude in result; By default all fields will be included

pullHierarchy.description: Flag to indicate whether to include hierarchy in the response

sortFields.description: Fields that will be sorted upon

searchAfter.description: This field is used to fetch item in batch. To retrieve the next page of the items. You need to set searchAfter in search criteria from previous result.

items.description: This field is used to fetch item in batch. To retrieve the next page of the items. You need to set searchAfter in search criteria from previous result.

dataPoolType.description: Item belongs to which data pool

totalPages.description: This field used to set total page number for given search criteria.

currentPage.description: This field used to set pagination page number.

message.description: This field used to set any warning message.

totalCount.description: This field used to set total count.

searchAfter.description: This field is used to fetch item in batch. To retrieve the next page of the items. You need to set it in search criteria.

items.description: This field is used to fetch item in batch. To retrieve the next page of the items. You need to set it in search criteria.

count.description: This is total product count for given criteria.
